com.google.wave.api
Class BlipData

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.BlipData

public class BlipData
extends java.lang.Object

BlipData is the serializable data representation of a Blip. It contains metadata, a text-only representation of the document content, and a list of annotations.

Author:
scovitz@google.com (Seth Covitz), mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya)

Constructor Detail

BlipData

public BlipData()
Constructs an empty BlipData object.

BlipData

public BlipData(java.lang.String waveId,
                java.lang.String waveletId,
                java.lang.String blipId,
                java.lang.String initialContent)
Constructs a BlipData object.

Parameters:
waveId - the wave id of the blip.
waveletId - the wavelet id of the blip.
blipId - the blip id.
initialContent - the initial content of the blip. If the supplied content doesn't start with a newline character, this constructor will auto-prepend that.

BlipData

public BlipData(BlipData blip)
Creates a deep copy/clone of a blip's data.

Parameters:
blip - The original blip to be copied.
